questions.question: Choose the word that is nearest in meaning to the <u>absent</u>: The principal was <u>absent</u> from the meeting.
questions.explanation: Absent means not present in a place, so the nearest meaning is 'away'.

questions.question: Choose the word that is opposite in meaning to the <u>pleasant</u>: The weather was <u>pleasant</u>.
questions.explanation: The opposite of pleasant is unpleasant.

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the verb in the sentence: The children _____ playing in the garden.
questions.explanation: The subject 'children' is plural, so the correct verb form is 'are'.

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition to complete the sentence: She is good _____ mathematics.
questions.explanation: The correct preposition is 'at' when referring to being good at a subject.

questions.question: Choose the word that is nearest in meaning to the <u>weak</u>: The old man was very <u>weak</u>.
questions.explanation: Weak and frail have similar meanings, referring to a lack of strength.

questions.question: Choose the correct punctuation mark to end the sentence: What is your name
questions.explanation: This is a question, so it should end with a question mark.

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the noun: There are many _____ in the zoo.
questions.explanation: The word 'deer' is the same in both singular and plural forms.

questions.question: Choose the correct pronoun to complete the sentence: _____ is my friend.
questions.explanation: The correct pronoun to use as a subject is 'he'.

questions.question: Choose the correct conjunction to complete the sentence: I will go to school _____ it rains.
questions.explanation: The correct conjunction to express a condition is 'if'.

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the adjective: This is the _____ book I have ever read.
questions.explanation: The superlative form of 'good' is 'best' when comparing more than two things.

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the verb: The committee _____ decided on the matter.
questions.explanation: Committee is a collective noun treated as singular, so 'has' is correct.

questions.question: Identify the sentence type: <u>What a beautiful day!</u>
questions.explanation: This sentence expresses strong emotion and ends with an exclamation mark.

questions.explanation: Generous means willing to give, which is similar to kind.
